Description: Body sherd of Attic red-figured pottery kylix: interior: thin reserved band around tondo; therein maenad and snake (spotted dress of maenad and spotted body of snake remaining); inscription in added red in field; exterior black; one repair hole preserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1888,0601.604 and may join 1900,0214.28. Also published in BSA v p.63 and fig. 2 on p. 64
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 47, pl. XXVII, no. 3)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 508, no. C68)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1461)
